result.title: Minimum Operations to Satisfy Requirement in Array
result.content:
Hi,

This is the problem I am currently working on:

You are given a list of n positive integers. In one operation, you can add 1 to any element of your choice. What is the minimum number of operations needed so that the absolute value in difference between all consecutive elements is less than or equal to a given positive integer, K.

I will give a sample test:

There are 3 positive integers, {1,4,2} and K=2. Here, only one operation will be needed, to add 1 to the first element. Then, we will have the array {2,4,2}, which has absolute value in difference between all consecutive integers less than or equal to 2.

Does anyone have any ideas how to solve this?

Thanks in advance, memset123
